title.rendered: A Tribute to the Pakistani Architect Yasmeen Lari

content.rendered:
Architects are not the ones who design our dwellings and, other lodgings rather they are the real legislators who research manufacturing materials, introduce the latest pieces of machinery and state-of-the-art techniques, and administer the architectural domain. Pakistan is privileged to have talented and endowed people who are the pride of the country. In the contribution of this treasure of vanity, the connoisseurs from the architectural domain are also subsidizing. One of the eminent names is Yasmeen Lari whose expertise in her field is flabbergasting. Recently, she has won the Jane Drew Prize 2020 for levitation the profile of a woman in architecture.

Credentials of Yasmeen Lari

Yasmeen Lari is the name that needs no primer of introduction. Being Pakistan’s first female architect she is credited to be a vigorous dynamism behind the architecture of Pakistan. Providing cosmic contribution to revitalizing the architectural sector of Pakistan, she got official retirement from architectural practice in 2000. However, she continued to work with collaboration with UNESCO. After her retirement, she started utilizing her experience to fight with the devastation and ferocity of natural disasters. Whether it was violent floods or destructive earthquakes, she never stepped back. She started building the victimize regions with bamboo and mud. With the help of natural building materials, she abetted to construct 40,000 homes in about four years.  When earthquakes shook Pakistan in 2013 and 2015, she proposed the strategy of volcanic activity-resistant lodgings with cross-braced bamboo structures. In addition to this, she has also worked for Pakistan Armed Forces when they were on the battlefield against Al-Qaeda and the Taliban in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa in 2007. In this adversity, she constructed communal kitchens in immigrant camps for the people who were expatriates. Nevertheless, the record of her contributions to the welfare of Pakistan is protuberant.

Jane Drew Prize 2020

The 79-year-old Yasmeen Lari is now the recipient of the prestigious award, Jane Drew Prize, as a result of her astounding and assiduous humanitarian efforts. The prize ceremony was held in London in March. Significantly, Jane Drew Award is a gong that appreciates the women’s contribution to architecture as she pioneered a respective place for women in the field dominated by men. As a result of her tireless altruistic work, her profile has also been encompassed among sixty women from all over the world who are the most active contributors of UNESCO.

Achievements and Rewards

Being one of the most eminent architects, she is the recipient of many awards and recognition certificates including national and international. From being a member of the Royal Institute of British Architects (RIBA) in 1969 to the first elected President of the Institute of Architects Pakistan (IAP) and the very first C.E.O. of Pakistan Council of Architects and Town Planners, she has an extensive record of her mesmeric endeavors and infinite rewards. She is also attributed to fetching the acknowledgment for the professions of the architectural sector and town development through PCATP Ordinance 1983. The catalog of her achievements and is fathomless. In 2006, she was awarded one of the highest civil awards i.e. Sitara-e-Imtiaz.

Some Projects of Yasmeen Lari

Architects are the ones who shape the building so as they shape them. However, Yasmeen Lari has a comprehensive catalog of completing prosperous projects. Lari’s most astonishing projects are the Angoori Bagh Housing (ABH in 1978), the Taj Mahal Hotel in 1981, the Finance and Trade Center; FTC in 1989, and the Pakistan State Oil House; PSO Company headquarters in 1991. Notably, her career is full of glitziness, encompassing the entitlement of extravagant monuments to living quarters which are built with the simplest and minimum appliance of means.
